intro: Babingtonia triandra, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small evergreen shrub that produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as birds and insects.
